methods.name: classify and execute calendar request
methods.description: Top-level method: figure out what the user wants, authenticate, then do it
steps: Classify the user's intent (create/read/update/delete)
Authenticate if not already authenticated
Execute the appropriate subtask method
Return final answer to user

failure_handling.authentication fails: Report auth failure to user, ask for credentials
failure_handling.execution fails: Diagnose error, retry with corrected parameters

methods.name: resolve details then post event
methods.description: Method for creating events — resolves relative dates, gets calendar ID, then posts
steps: Get current datetime (needed for relative date resolution)
Get user's calendars to find calendar_id
Parse event details from user message (title, start, end, description, reminder)
Convert any relative dates to ISO 8601 using current datetime
Post event to Calendar API

failure_handling.missing required fields: Ask user for the missing information

methods.name: find event then patch
methods.description: Method for updating events — finds the target event first, then patches
steps: Get all events to find the one the user wants to modify
Match user's description to an event (by title, date, or ID)
Apply only the changes the user specified (don't overwrite other fields)
Confirm the update to the user

failure_handling.event not found: Show user their events, ask which one they meant
failure_handling.multiple matches: List matching events, ask user to pick one

methods.name: confirm then delete event
methods.description: Method for deleting events — finds the event, confirms with user if ambiguous
steps: Get all events to find the target
If multiple matches, ask user to confirm which one
Delete the event
Confirm deletion to user

failure_handling.event not found: Show user their events, ask which one they meant

methods.name: get and format events
methods.description: Method for reading events — retrieves and presents them clearly
steps: Get all events from Calendar API
Format them in a readable way (date, time, title, description)
Present to user, organized chronologically

failure_handling.no events found: Tell user they have no upcoming events
